title: Vanishing Local News Coverage Is Bad for Voting
description:
A recent Duke University study says the quaintly and quality of local news is dropping. These 'news deserts' across the country are leading to lower voter turnout and unchecked government officials. David Meyers speaks with Bloomberg News reporter Riley Griffin. 
 
FOLLOW UP
 Riley's latest: Local News Is Dying, and It’s Taking Small Town America With It
 You can follow Riley at @rileyraygriffin
